0.title: üß† Get Unstuck. Get Clarity
0.text:
Feeling foggy, overwhelmed, or torn between choices?
DrishiQ helps you organize your thoughts, reflect deeply, and make wiser decisions ‚Äî through emotionally intelligent, AI-powered conversations.

1.title: üí¨ Can't Pay? Your Challenge Still Matters
1.text:
Struggling to figure things out but can't afford a session?
We hear you. At DrishiQ, no voice goes unheard. Share your challenge ‚Äî and we'll try to connect you with a sponsored session.

2.title: üíö Give the Gift of Clarity
2.text:
A single conversation can shift someone's world.
Donate a session to help someone move from confusion to confidence. Your kindness could be the turning point in their journey.

3.title: üîÑ Share to Inspire. Earn Credits
3.text:
Did DrishiQ help you solve a challenge or gain emotional clarity?
Your story could inspire someone else ‚Äî and earn you session credits in return.

4.title: üåç One Platform. Many Journeys
4.text:
Every journey to clarity is different. Some seek guidance, others offer support.
DrishiQ brings it all together ‚Äî powered by insight, empathy, and shared human growth.

areas.heading: Areas We Help
areas.subtitle: Every challenge is unique, but the path to clarity isn't. We help you navigate through life's most common yet complex situations.
areas.areas_subtitle_long: Every challenge is unique, but the path to clarity isn't. We help you navigate through life's most common yet complex situations with personalized AI-powered conversations that understand your context and provide actionable insights.

card1.title: Mental Clarity & Overwhelm
card1.quote1: I keep overthinking everything ‚Äî and end up doing nothing
card1.quote2: My mind feels cluttered all the time
card1.quote3: I don't know what matters to me anymore
card1.quote4: Every decision feels like it could change my entire life
card1.quote5: I'm paralyzed by all the possibilities and what-ifs
card1.quote6: Sometimes I wish someone would just tell me what to do
card1.back1: Clarity comes from action, not endless thinking
card1.back2: Your intuition knows more than your overthinking mind
card1.back3: Perfect is the enemy of progress ‚Äî start with good enough
card1.back4: Most decisions are reversible ‚Äî you can always adjust course
card1.back5: Focus on the next small step, not the entire journey
card1.back6: Overwhelm is often a sign that you're trying to control too much
card1.back7: Take breaks ‚Äî your mind needs rest to process and clear
card1.back8: Write down your thoughts ‚Äî externalizing helps organize them

card2.title: Direction & Purpose
card2.quote1: I'm not sure what I want in life
card2.quote2: I'm good at a few things, but I don't know which path to take
card2.quote3: Everyone expects something different from me ‚Äî I feel pulled apart
card2.quote4: I'm doing okay, but something feels off
card2.quote5: I see others with clear goals and I feel lost
card2.quote6: What if I choose wrong and waste years of my life?
card2.back1: Purpose emerges from doing, not from thinking about doing
card2.back2: Your values are your compass ‚Äî what truly matters to you?
card2.back3: Comparison is the thief of joy ‚Äî your path is uniquely yours
card2.back4: Every experience teaches you something about what you want
card2.back5: It's okay to change direction ‚Äî that's how you find your way
card2.back6: Look for what energizes you ‚Äî that's often your calling
card2.back7: Start with what you're curious about, not what you think you should do
card2.back8: Your purpose can evolve ‚Äî it doesn't have to be fixed forever

card3.title: Emotional Expression & Judgment
card3.quote1: I can't talk without feeling judged
card3.quote2: People don't really listen ‚Äî they just give advice
card3.quote3: I smile outside, but I'm overwhelmed inside
card3.quote4: I feel like I'm always performing, never being real
card3.quote5: When I try to open up, people either fix me or dismiss me
card3.quote6: I'm tired of pretending I have it all together
card3.back1: Your feelings are valid ‚Äî you don't need permission to feel them
card3.back3: Find your tribe ‚Äî people who listen without fixing
card3.back4: Authenticity attracts the right people into your life
card3.back5: You deserve to be heard and understood, not fixed
card3.back6: Judgment from others often reflects their own insecurities
card3.back7: Practice expressing yourself in safe spaces first
card3.back8: Your emotional truth is your superpower, not your weakness

card4.title: Performance & Confidence
card4.quote1: I freeze during important moments ‚Äî even when I'm prepared
card4.quote2: Preparing for a senior job interview‚Ä¶ and freaking out inside
card4.quote3: I know my subject, but I struggle to speak with confidence
card4.quote4: My mind goes blank when I need to perform under pressure
card4.quote5: I rehearse everything but still feel like I'm not good enough
card4.quote6: What if they see through me and realize I'm not qualified?
card4.back1: Confidence is built through action, not preparation
card4.back2: You are more qualified than you think ‚Äî trust your knowledge
card4.back3: Nervousness is normal ‚Äî it shows you care about doing well
card4.back4: Focus on serving others, not impressing them
card4.back5: Your worth isn't determined by one performance or outcome
card4.back6: Practice breathing techniques to calm your nervous system
card4.back7: Remember past successes ‚Äî you've overcome challenges before
card4.back8: Confidence grows with each small step you take

card5.title: Skill Improvement
card5.quote1: I'm stuck in a plateau with my tennis forehand
card5.quote2: I want to improve, but I don't know what's holding me back
card5.quote3: I've practiced, but something's not clicking
card5.quote4: I watch others excel while I stay stuck at the same level
card5.quote5: Maybe I'm just not naturally talented enough
card5.quote6: I'm afraid I've hit my ceiling and this is as good as I'll get
card5.back1: Plateaus are part of the learning process ‚Äî not the end
card5.back2: Break down the skill into smaller, specific components
card5.back3: Get feedback from someone who can see what you can't
card5.back4: Sometimes you need to unlearn before you can relearn
card5.back5: Progress isn't always linear ‚Äî trust the process
card5.back6: Focus on deliberate practice, not just repetition
card5.back7: Record yourself to see what you can't feel
card5.back8: Take breaks ‚Äî your brain consolidates learning during rest

card6.title: Relationship Confusion
card6.quote1: Not sure if I should continue my marriage
card6.quote2: We argue often ‚Äî but I don't know what we're really fighting about
card6.quote3: I feel disconnected in my relationship but can't explain why
card6.quote4: I love them, but I don't feel like myself around them anymore
card6.quote5: Every conversation turns into a battle I didn't mean to start
card6.quote6: I'm scared of being alone, but I'm lonely even when we're together
card6.back1: Healthy relationships require both people to show up authentically
card6.back2: Communication is about understanding, not being right
card6.back3: Sometimes love isn't enough ‚Äî compatibility and growth matter too
card6.back4: You can love someone and still need to let them go
card6.back5: Being alone is better than being lonely in a relationship
card6.back6: Pay attention to patterns ‚Äî they reveal the truth about your relationship
card6.back7: Couples therapy isn't a last resort ‚Äî it's a tool for growth
card6.back8: Your happiness matters ‚Äî don't sacrifice it for the relationship

card7.title: Young Adult Dilemmas
card7.quote1: I'm good at science, but don't know what's next
card7.quote2: I'm graduating soon ‚Äî and I feel lost
card7.quote3: My parents want one thing, but I want something else
card7.quote4: Everyone else seems to have their life figured out except me
card7.quote5: I'm terrified of making the wrong choice and ruining my future
card7.quote6: What if I'm not smart enough or good enough for what I want to do?
card7.back1: Your twenties are for exploration, not having it all figured out
card7.back2: Follow your curiosity ‚Äî it will lead you to your passion
card7.back3: It's your life to live, not your parents' to design
card7.back4: Everyone is figuring it out as they go ‚Äî you're not behind
card7.back5: The best decisions come from following your values, not others' expectations
card7.back6: Internships and side projects teach you more than any degree
card7.back7: Network with people who inspire you ‚Äî they'll open doors
card7.back8: Mistakes in your twenties are investments in your future wisdom

blog.heading: Featured Blog Posts
blog.subtitle: Insights, stories, and guidance to help you navigate life's challenges with clarity and confidence.

testimonials.heading: Real Stories, Real Impact
testimonials.subtitle: Hear from people who've found clarity and direction through DrishiQ.
testimonials.default_content: DrishiQ helped me see through my challenges and find a clear path forward. The AI-powered conversations were surprisingly insightful and supportive.
